Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Necklace
Description: Row of disc-shaped beads with straight edges. These beads were fashioned in roughly circular fragments of ostrich eggshell. They were then perforated with a bow saw and the sides polished in order to give them a more circular shape. This material was highly appreciated by ancient Nubian people, who used it for corporal ornaments as well as for decorating clothing and animal-skin covers.
